result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Charles Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Charles Curtis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Charles Curtis was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Anthony Charles Curtis in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney William Reabe in court for Anthony Charles Curtis. 
Court calls case.
Court reviews the case.
Atty Reabe heard - case has been resolved.
Atty Reabe provides plea form.
ADA heard  - will be filing an amended information today.
ADA provides a paper copy of the amended information to the Court.
Court accepts the amended information.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Reabe agrees.
Deft agrees.
ADA reads charge on Count 5.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 5.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Atty Reabe satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 5 on the amended information.
Court dismisses outright Counts 1, 2, 3, and 4.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Reabe heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 5: 
153 days jail.
Credit for 153 days time served.
Remit fines and costs.
Payment of the DNA surcharge only = $200.00 due within 60 days or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 07-13-2022.
Appeal rights.
Court removes the jury trial from the court's calendar that is currently scheduled for July 20.

Court calls case. 
Atty spks- case has not been resolved. 
Court reviews jury selection. 
12 jurors + 1 alternate + 5 strikes = 23 jurors up front.
Court reviews final offer that was made today.
Atty has reviewed new offer with deft. 
Deft rejects all offers. 
Court reviews prior convictions- 16.
Court reviews witness lists. 
ADA spks on defense witness- will need to prepare order to produce. 
Atty agrees. 
Court reviews States Motion in Limine. 
Court grants States Motion in Limine. 
Court reviews Defendant's Motion in Limine. 
Court grants Defendant's Motion in Limine. 
Court grants sequestration order. 
Any stipulations filed prior to trial.

Court calls case. 
Court reviews scheduled hearings with deft. 
All parties agree. 
All proposed verdicts, jury instruction and motions to be filed no later than close of business on June 20, 2022.
